longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To amend and consolidate the law relating to the police force.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Police Force Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.content: All the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to all persons who, at the commencement of this Ordinance, are serving in the police force established under any Ordinance repealed by this Ordinance and service under any such repealed Ordinance shall for the purpose of pay, allowances, gratuities and pensions, be deemed to be service under this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a person who has attained the age of 18 years, the consent of that person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person who has not attained the age of 18 years, the consent both of that person and of his parent or guardian; (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)

section.def: auxiliary force (輔警隊) means the Hong Kong Auxiliary Police Force established under the Hong Kong Auxiliary Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 233); (Added 58 of 1999 s. 3. Amended 14 of 2002 s. 3)
auxiliary officer (輔警人員) means a member of the auxiliary force; (Added 58 of 1999 s. 3)
civil service provident fund scheme (公務員公積金計劃) means the Civil Service Provident Fund Scheme referred to in the government regulations; (Added 6 of 2009 s. 5)
Commissioner (處長) means the Commissioner of Police of Hong Kong or a deputy commissioner; (Replaced 13 of 1953 s. 2. Amended 76 of 1999 s. 3)
DNA means deoxyribonucleic acid; (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)
DNA information (DNA 資料) means genetic information derived from the forensic DNA analysis of an intimate sample or a non-intimate sample; (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)
gazetted police officer (憲委級警務人員) includes officers of all ranks from and including the Commissioner down to and including superintendent; (Amended 37 of 1974 s. 2)

government regulations (政府規例) means the administrative rules known as the Government Regulations and any other administrative rules or instruments regulating the public service; (Added 76 of 1999 s. 3)

Independent Commission Against Corruption (廉政公署) means the Independent Commission Against Corruption established under section 3 of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204); (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5. Amended 1 of 2003 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sample of blood, semen or any other tissue fluid, urine or hair other than head hair;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a dental impression;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a swab taken from a private part of a person’s body or from a person’s body orifice other than the mouth; (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)

section.def: non-commissioned officer (非委任級人員) means a police officer below the rank of inspector down to and including sergeant and also means detectives of corresponding ranks; (Amended 42 of 1977 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sample of head hair;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sample taken from a nail or from under a nail;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a swab taken from any part, other than a private part, of a person’s body or from the mouth but not any other body orifice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: saliva;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: an impression of any part of a person’s body other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an impression of a private part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an impression of the face; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the identifying particulars described in section 59(6); (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)

section.def: police constable or constable (警員) means a police officer under the rank of sergeant and also means detective police constable or detective constable; (Amended 42 of 1977 s. 2)
police officer (警務人員) includes any member of the police force; (Amended 37 of 1974 s. 2; 58 of 1999 s. 3)
police regulations (警察規例) means regulations made in exercise of the powers conferred by section 45 and any regulations continued or continuing in force upon the enactment of this Ordinance;
Police Welfare Fund (警察福利基金) means the Police Welfare Fund continued by section 39B; (Replaced 58 of 1999 s. 3)
private part (私處) in relation to a person’s body, means the genital or anal area and includes the breasts in the case of a woman; (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)

provident fund benefits (公積金利益), in relation to a person, means the part of that person’s beneficial interests in the civil service provident fund scheme that is attributable to sums derived from the voluntary contributions made by the Government, as employer, in respect of that person under section 11(4) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), together with the income, profits or losses arising from any investment of those sums and of such income or profits; (Added 6 of 2009 s. 5)

def.name: PublicServiceAdministrationOrder
def.leadIn: Public Service (Administration) Order (《公務人員(管理)命令》) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Public Service (Administration) Order 1997 (Executive Order No. 1 of 1997);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any other regulation made or any direction given under that Order,

def.continued: as amended from time to time; (Added 76 of 1999 s. 3)

section.def: registered dentist (註冊牙醫) has the same meaning as it has in the Dentist Registration Ordinance (Cap. 156); (Added 68 of 2000 s. 5)

def.name: RetirementBenefits
def.leadIn: retirement benefits (退休福利), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the pension, gratuity or other allowance of that person as provided for under the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pension benefits of that person as provided for under the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the provident fund benefits of that person; (Added 6 of 2009 s. 5)

def.name: SeriousArrestableOffence
def.leadIn: serious arrestable offence (嚴重的可逮捕罪行) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence endangering national security;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an offence specified in Schedule 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other offence for which a person may under or by virtue of any law be sentenced to imprisonment for a term not less than 7 years. (Replaced 6 of 2024 s. 151)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Administration of police force by Commissioner
section.text: The Commissioner, subject to the orders and control of the Chief Executive, shall be charged with the supreme direction and administration of the police force.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Powers of Commissioner or deputy
section.content: The Commissioner or a deputy commissioner may exercise and perform any of the powers conferred or duties imposed by law on a police officer.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Powers, etc. to be subject to regulations, etc.
section.content: All powers granted to and duties imposed by law on any police officer shall be exercised or performed in accordance with police regulations and police orders made under this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Delegation of powers

subsection.content: Save where the contrary intention appears from the context of any enactment and subject to any special instructions of the Commissioner, a deputy commissioner may exercise or discharge any of the powers or duties which the Commissioner by any enactment is entitled to exercise or required to discharge.

Save where the contrary intention appears from the context of any enactment and subject to any special instructions of the Chief Executive, the Commissioner may authorize any police officer not below the rank of station sergeant, or any public officer attached to the police force not below a grade or rank equivalent to that of station sergeant, by name, office or appointment, to exercise or discharge any of the powers or duties which the Commissioner by any enactment is entitled to exercise or required to discharge. (Amended 42 of 1977 s. 3; 76 of 1999 s. 3)
For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this section shall be deemed to derogate from any power of delegation conferred upon the Commissioner by the provisions of any other enactment.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Prohibition against police officer being a member of a trade union

subsection.content: It shall not be lawful for a police officer to be a member of any trade union and any police officer who contravenes this provision shall be disqualified from continuing to be a member of the police force.

If any question arises whether a body is a trade union to which this section applies the question shall be determined by the Registrar of Trade Unions appointed under section 3 of the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish such associations as he may think fit, composed only of police officers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recognize any association composed only of police officers. (Added 23 of 1972 s. 2. Amended 69 of 1977 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may seek the advice of any such association on any matter relating to the welfare and conditions of service of all or any police officers. (Added 23 of 1972 s. 2)
An association established or recognized under subsection (3) shall not be a trade union for the purposes of this section or of any other law. (Added 23 of 1972 s. 2)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Liability for service
section.text: All police officers shall be bound to serve at any place in Hong Kong or on board any vessel in the service of the Government.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Duties of police force
section.leadIn: The duties of the police force shall be to take lawful measures for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: preserving the public peace;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: preventing and detecting crimes and offences;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: preventing injury to life and property;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: apprehending all persons whom it is lawful to apprehend and for whose apprehension sufficient grounds exists;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: regulating processions and assemblies in public places or places of public resort;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: controlling traffic upon public thoroughfares and removing obstructions therefrom;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: preserving order in public places and places of public resort, at public meetings and in assemblies for public amusements, for which purpose any police officer on duty shall have free admission to all such places and meetings and assemblies while open to any of the public;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: assisting coroners to discharge their duties and exercise their powers under the Coroners Ordinance (Cap. 504); (Added 27 of 1997 s. 75)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: assisting in carrying out any revenue, excise, sanitary, conservancy, quarantine, immigration and alien registration laws;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: assisting in preserving order in the waters of Hong Kong and in enforcing port and maritime regulation therein; (Amended 76 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: executing summonses, subpoenas, warrants, commitments and other process issued by the courts;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: exhibiting informations and conducting prosecutions;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: protecting unclaimed and lost property and finding the owners thereof;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: taking charge of and impounding stray animals;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: assisting in the protection of life and property at fires;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: protecting public property from loss or injury;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: attending the criminal courts and, if specially ordered, the civil courts and keeping order therein;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: escorting and guarding prisoners;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: executing such other duties as may by law be imposed on a police officer.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Constitution of police force
section.text: The police force of Hong Kong shall consist of such gazetted police officers, inspectors, non-commissioned officers and constables as shall by annual vote or otherwise be from time to time provided for by the Chief Executive and the Legislative Council.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Payment of police force
section.text: Provisions for the payment and maintenance of the police force under this Ordinance shall be by charges on the general revenue of Hong Kong, to such amounts and in such proportion as may from time to time by annual vote or otherwise be voted by the Legislative Council.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Appointment, etc. of gazetted police officers

subsection.content: A gazetted police officer shall be appointed, interdicted, suspended or dismissed according to the terms of the Public Service (Administration) Order and government regulations for the time being in force but subject nevertheless to any special conditions of his appointment. (Amended 53 of 1960 s. 3; 76 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a gazetted police officer may not resign from the police force except by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: giving to the Commissioner 3 months’ notice in writing of his intention to resign; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the prior consent of the Commissioner, paying into the Treasury 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice. (Added 17 of 1975 s. 2)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Appointment and promotion of inspectors, non-commissioned officers and constables

subsection.content: An inspector may be appointed and promoted by the Commissioner.
A non-commissioned officer or constable may be appointed, advanced in salary or promoted by the Commissioner. (Amended 42 of 1977 s. 4)
A non-commissioned officer may be reverted in rank by the Commissioner.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Dismissal
section.content: Subject to section 13(1) a police officer may be dismissed under the provisions of this Ordinance or by virtue of the rights reserved by section 38.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Termination of service in the public interest
section.text: The service of any police officer may be terminated in accordance with the Public Service (Administration) Order on the ground that, having regard to the conditions of the public service, the usefulness of the police officer thereto and all other circumstances of the case, such termination is desirable in the public interest.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Interdiction

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner considers that the public interest requires that a police officer other than a gazetted police officer should cease to exercise the powers and functions of his office forthwith, he may interdict the police officer from the exercise of such powers and functions where— (Amended 12 of 1982 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disciplinary or criminal proceedings are being instituted or are about to be instituted against such officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such officer is the subject of an inquiry into his conduct in connexion with his duties as a police officer or the subject of an investigation into any report, allegation or suspicion that he has committed an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A police officer who has been interdicted under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(a), shall be allowed to receive such proportion of his pay, not being less than one-half, as the Commissioner shall in every case direct, until such time as he may be convicted of an offence whereupon the matter shall be determined under section 37(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(b), shall not on that account receive less than his full pay.

subsection.content: If the proceedings, inquiry or investigation do not result in the dismissal or other punishment of such officer, he shall be entitled to the full amount of the pay which he would have received if he had not been interdicted.

If the proceedings, inquiry or investigation result in punishment other than the dismissal of such officer, he may be paid such proportion of the pay withheld as a result of his interdiction as the Commissioner may direct.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Warrant card
section.content: A warrant card shall be issued to every police officer, and shall be evidence of his appointment under this Ordinance.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Exemption in respect of civil process

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the pay and allowances of a non-commissioned officer or constable shall not be assignable or transferable; (Amended 74 of 1980 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a debt due to the Government; (Amended 76 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fine imposed by law;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an order for the payment of alimony or maintenance made by any court;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an assignment made under the Public Officers (Assignment of Emoluments) Ordinance (Cap. 363). (Added 74 of 1980 s. 10)

subsection.content: The pay and allowances of a non-commissioned officer or constable shall not pass to the official receiver or a trustee on the bankruptcy of such non-commissioned officer or constable nor shall they form part of his estate for the purpose of bankruptcy. (Amended L.N. 375 of 1991)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Police officer to be deemed on duty
section.text: Every police officer shall for the purposes of this Ordinance be deemed to be always on duty when required to act as such and shall perform the duties and exercise the powers granted to him under this Ordinance or any other law at any and every place in Hong Kong where he may be doing duty.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Clothing
section.content: Every police officer shall be provided with such articles of uniform and equipment as may be necessary for the effectual discharge of his duties. Such articles shall be kept and used according to police orders.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Discharge and resignation of non-commissioned officer and constable

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the provisions of section 38, a non-commissioned officer or constable who has not completed 10 years of service may be discharged from the police force by the Commissioner by 1 month’s notice in writing or paying him 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice. (Amended 13 of 1953 s. 4)

content.leadIn: A non-commissioned officer or constable may resign from the police force by giving to the Commissioner 1 month’s notice in writing or, with the prior consent of the Commissioner, by paying into the Treasury 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice of his intention to resign from the police force: (Amended 13 of 1953 s. 4)
content.proviso: Provided that the Commissioner may, on compassionate grounds or where he considers it to be in the best interests of the police force, accept a shorter period of notice or the payment of a lesser amount of salary in lieu of notice. (Added 12 of 1982 s. 4)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Temporary police officers

subsection.content: The Commissioner may without written engagement employ persons to serve temporarily as police officers.

A temporary police officer shall be deemed to serve from month to month, every such engagement being held to commence on the first and to be determinable on the last day of each successive month, but notwithstanding the terms of such engagement such police officer shall serve under the same conditions of service in respect of pay, allowances, gratuities and pensions as an auxiliary officer of equivalent rank, and shall have and may exercise all the powers and privileges of such rank and be liable to all the provisions of discipline for such rank while so serving. (Amended 2 of 1959 Second Schedule; 29 of 1969 s. 2; L.N. 362 of 1997; 58 of 1999 s. 3)

A temporary police officer may be discharged at any time after 1 month’s notice in writing or may resign upon giving the Commissioner 1 month’s notice in writing or, with the prior consent of the Commissioner, by paying into the Treasury 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice. (Amended 13 of 1953 s. 5)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Discharge and resignation of inspector

content.leadIn: Without prejudice to the provisions of section 38, the Commissioner may at any time prior to the confirmation in his appointment of an inspector discharge an inspector from the police force by giving him 3 months’ notice in writing or paying to him 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice:
content.proviso: Provided that where such inspector was serving as a constable or non-commissioned officer immediately prior to his appointment as an inspector, he shall not be discharged under the provisions of this subsection, but the Commissioner may, at any time prior to the confirmation of such inspector as aforesaid, revert him to the rank which he held immediately before his appointment as inspector. (Added 13 of 1953 s. 6. Amended 12 of 1982 s. 5)

content.leadIn: An inspector may resign from the police force by giving to the Commissioner 3 months’ notice in writing of his intention to resign or, with the prior consent of the Commissioner, by paying into the Treasury 1 month’s salary in lieu of notice: (Amended 13 of 1953 s. 6)
content.proviso: Provided that the Commissioner may, on compassionate grounds or where he considers it to be in the best interests of the police force, accept a shorter period of notice or the payment of a lesser amount of salary in lieu of notice. (Added 12 of 1982 s. 5)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Declaration of office
section.content: Every police officer shall, before entering on the duties of his office, take before a magistrate or gazetted police officer an oath or declaration of office in the form prescribed in Schedule 1.
section.sourceNote: (Amended 11 of 1968 Schedule; 47 of 1997 s. 10; 68 of 2000 s. 6)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Delivery of Government property on leaving the force

subsection.content: Every police officer who by resignation, dismissal, discharge or otherwise leaves the police force, shall before leaving deliver up each and every article of uniform, clothing, arms, accoutrements and other Government property which may be in his possession.

Any person neglecting so to deliver up such property shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 1 or to imprisonment for 3 months, and in addition thereto shall be liable to pay the value of the property not delivered up which value shall be ascertained by such magistrate in a summary way and shall be recoverable as a fine. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Desertion
section.content: Any police officer who deserts shall be liable on summary conviction to imprisonment for 12 months and all arrears of pay due to him shall be forfeited.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Absence from duty
section.content: Whenever it is alleged that any inspector, non-commissioned officer or constable has been absent from duty without leave for a period of not less than 21 days, a gazetted police officer appointed by the Commissioner shall inquire into the fact and circumstances of such absence, and if he is satisfied that such person was absent from duty for a period of not less than 21 days without leave or other sufficient cause, he shall so declare, and such declaration shall for the purposes of section 37 be deemed to be a conviction under section 28.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Police officers to obey lawful orders
section.content: Every police officer shall obey all lawful orders of his superior officers whether given verbally or in writing and shall obey and conform to police regulations and orders made under this Ordinance.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Summary dismissal*

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any provision of this Ordinance and any other law, provision of Public Service (Administration) Order or government regulations to the contrary, and without prejudice to section 38, the Commissioner may summarily dismiss any police officer whom he is satisfied is guilty of contravening police regulations, or any police orders whether given verbally or in writing. (Amended 12 of 1982 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may, if he thinks fit in any particular case, declare that— (Amended 6 of 2009 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a police officer dismissed under subsection (1) is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purposes only of the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89), deemed to have retired from the public service in accordance with section 6(1)(d) of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provident fund benefits of a police officer dismissed under subsection (1) are to be vested in that officer. (Amended 36 of 1987 s. 45; 6 of 2009 s. 6)

tr.td: This section was amended by section 6 of the Disciplined Services Legislation (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2009 (6 of 2009). For the relevant transitional provisions, please see section 30 of that Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Punishment of non-commissioned officers and constables
section.content: Any non-commissioned officer or constable found guilty of an offence against discipline under regulations made under section 45 and required to resign or dismissed for failure to do so, shall not receive salary in lieu of notice.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Threatening or insulting another officer of senior or equal rank
section.content: Any police officer who threatens or insults another officer of senior or equal rank when such other officer is on duty or when such threat or insult relates to or is consequent on the discharge of duty by the officer so threatened or insulted, shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 1 or to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Conviction of police officer*

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance shall be construed to exempt any police officer from being proceeded against by the ordinary course of law when accused of any offence punishable under any other Ordinance or law.
No police officer who has been acquitted by a court of any crime or offence shall be tried departmentally on the same charge.
A sentence passed upon a police officer subject to this Ordinance shall be in no respect affected by such officer ceasing to be subject to this Ordinance by discharge or otherwise.

No pay or allowance shall be payable to any police officer with effect from the date of the finding by a court in criminal proceedings that a charge against such officer in respect of a criminal offence has been proved against him unless the approval of the Commissioner of such payment be given. (Amended 12 of 1982 s. 8; 6 of 2009 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: A police officer in respect of whom a court has found in criminal proceedings that a charge against him in respect of a criminal offence has been proved and whose appeal or other application for review of those proceedings is not allowed or is abandoned or withdrawn, may be dismissed without retirement benefits, compulsorily retired with full retirement benefits or reduced retirement benefits or without retirement benefits, reduced or reverted in rank or subjected to a lesser punishment— (Amended 12 of 1982 s. 8; 61 of 1988 s. 9; 6 of 2009 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Chief Executive in the case of an inspector who has been confirmed in his appointment, subject to any conditions of his appointment; and (Amended 76 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by the Commissioner in the case of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an inspector who has not been confirmed in his appointment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a non-commissioned officer; or

subsection.proviso: Provided that an inspector shall not be reduced or reverted to a rank lower than inspector.

subsection.content: Any station sergeant or sergeant dismissed under subsection (5) shall be reduced to the rank of constable before dismissal.

subsection.leadIn: Where a police officer is dismissed under subsection (5) any arrears of pay due to him may be forfeited by order of— (Amended L.N. 587 of 1995)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive in the case of an inspector who has been confirmed in his appointment subject to any conditions of his appointment; and (Amended 76 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by the Commissioner in the case of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an inspector who has not been confirmed in his appointment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a non-commissioned officer; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a police constable.

def.name: CriminalProceedings,CriminalOffence
def.leadIn: In subsections (4) and (5) criminal proceedings (刑事法律程序) and criminal offence (刑事罪行) include, respectively—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings in; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a criminal offence against the law of,

def.continued: any place outside Hong Kong. (Added 12 of 1982 s. 8)

tr.td: This section was amended by sections 7 and 29 of the Disciplined Services Legislation (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2009 (6 of 2009). For the relevant transitional provisions, please see section 30 of that Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Saving of the rights of the Central People’s Government and the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region
section.text: Nothing in this Ordinance contained shall be construed to limit the right of the Central People’s Government to dismiss or terminate the appointment of the Commissioner of Police, or of the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region to dismiss or terminate the appointment of any other police officer, and without compensation.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Definitions: Part IV

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Amenities
def.leadIn: amenities (設施活動) means any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b

def.leadIn: beneficiaries (受益人) means the following persons—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: civilian officers;

paragraph.name: d

paragraph.name: e

paragraph.name: f

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: dependants of persons specified in subsection (2);

subsection.def: civilian officer (文職人員) means a public officer who holds a civilian police departmental grade office in the police force;

def.name: CivilianPoliceDepartmentalGradeOffice
def.leadIn: civilian police departmental grade office (警察部門職系中的文職職位) means any of the following positions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: force armourer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: force welfare officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: interviewer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: police communications assistant;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: police communications computer operator;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: police communications officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: police translator;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: police telecommunications inspector;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any other position prescribed by the police regulations for the purposes of this definition;

paragraph.name: a
